column4: I can barely hear any sound when my volume's turned up 100%. Any suggestions?
Is there any way to boost volume past 100%?
Use VLC.. it allows up to 400%.
Alternatively, open volume control and turn up all internal volumes too.
Nope.. I haven't found a way to do that.. But you need probably a sound post-processor which will have a preamplifier...
I will search for one. I don't know.. If i find, i'll let you know..
While there are no programs I could find for sound post processors, are you sure you have turned up all the controls after right clicking volume icon and selecting "Open volume control" ?
Okay.. Gimme a few more minutes..
Download this package called gnome-alsamixer. It will give you a lot of volume controls. Try tweaking all of them and see if you get the volume you deserve...
alright. I'll tell you about it in a second.
that did not help -- same options as with the default volume control.
Okay.. one last method.. Go to System->Preferences->Sound and select different devices in the sound playback drop down and test each one to find out which one gives you the maximum volume..
all of them give the same volume. Some could not be used for playback, but one COULD be used for playback but gave NO sound (as opposed to very quiet).
